members.member:
Provides methods for comparing Neurotechnology Finger Records (NFRecords) using algorithm encapsulated in Neurotechnology Finger Matcher (NFMatcher) object.
Note NFMatcher is obsolete. Use NMatcher instead.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMatcher.ParameterMatchingThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying matching threshold (biggest allowed FAR) parameter of type int. Parameter value is equal to - 12 \* log10(FAR) and must be not less than zero (for example, 48 for FAR = 0.01%).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMatcher.ParameterMaximalRotation
member.summary: Identifier specifying modulus of maximal rotation allowed between two matched NFRecords parameter of type byte. Parameter value is specified in 180/128 degrees units and cannot be greater than 128 (180 degrees).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMatcher.ParameterMatchingSpeed
member.summary: Identifier specifies the matching speed. Parameter value can be one of the NfmSpeed enumeration members.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMatcher.ParameterMode
member.summary: Identifier specifying mode (parameter value set) parameter of type int. Parameter value can be one of the ModeXXX.

member.value: The score of two matched fingerprints.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfmMatchDetails.CenterX
member.summary: Gets X coordinate center of mass of the second.
member.returns: X coordinate of the center of mass.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfmMatchDetails.CenterY
member.summary: Gets Y coordinate center of mass of the second.
member.returns: Y coordinate of the center of mass.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfmMatchDetails.RawRotation
member.summary: Rotation of second matched NFRecord against the first one in radians.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfmMatchDetails.Rotation
member.summary: Gets rotation of second matched NFRecord against the first one.
member.remarks: The rotation is specified in 180/128 degrees units in counterclockwise order. To eliminate rotation, the second NFRecord minutiae and singular points have to be rotated by the value around center of its minutiae bounding box.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfmMatchDetails.TranslationX
member.summary: Gets horizontal translation of second matched NFRecord against the first one.
member.remarks: To eliminate horizontal translation, the second NFRecord minutiae and singular points have to be shifted down by the value. Note that Rotation must be eliminated first.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfmMatchDetails.TranslationY
member.summary: Gets vertical translation of second matched NFRecord against the first one.
member.remarks: To eliminate vertical translation, the second NFRecord minutiae and singular points have to be shifted down by the value. Note that Rotation must be eliminated first.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfmMatchDetails.MatedMinutiae
member.summary: The NIndexPair structures array.

members.member:
Provides methods and properties for comparing Neurotechnology Fingers Templates (NFTemplates), encapsulated in Neurotechnology Fingers Matcher (NfsMatcher) object.
Note This class and all methods in this class are obsolete. Use NMatcher instead.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfsMatcher.PartNone
member.summary: Identifier specifying that retrieving or setting parameter for NfsMatcher.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfsMatcher.PartNfm
member.summary: Identifier specifying that retrieving or setting parameter for NFMatcher contained in NfsMatcher.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfsMatcher.ParameterMatchingThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying matching threshold (biggest allowed FAR) parameter of type int. Parameter value is equal to - 12 \* log10(FAR) and must be not less than zero (for example, 48 for FAR = 0.01%).

members.member:
Identifier specifying minimal number of fingerprints from probe template to match parameter of type int. Parameter value is from zero to NFTemplate.MaxRecordCount.
Note Obsolete, use Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterFingersMinMatchedCount instead.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NfsMatcher.ParameterMinMatchedFingerCountThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying matching threshold (biggest allowed FAR) when matching is stopped (with respect to ParameterMinMatchedFingerCount parameter value) parameter of type int. Parameter value is equal to -12 * log10(FAR) and must be not less than zero (for example, 48 for FAR = 0.01%).

members.member:
Provides functionality for comparing face feature templates using algorithm encapsulated in Neurotechnology NLMatcher object.
Note NLMatcher is obsolete. Use NMatcher instead.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLMatcher.ParameterMatchingThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying the threshold that distinguishes genuine from impostor. Templates that score more than threshold are considered to be of the same person. For possible values of this parameter see section.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLMatcher.ParameterMatchingSpeed
member.summary: Identifier specifying matching speed parameter. Parameter value can be one of the NlmSpeed enumeration members.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLMatcher.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NLMatcher class.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLMatcher.Verify(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to verify to given templates.
member.param: Pointer to the memory block that contains first face feature template (Neurotec.Biometrics.NLRecord). This template must be uncompressed.
Pointer to the memory block that contains second face feature template (Neurotec.Biometrics.NLRecord). This template must be compressed.
member.remarks:
Method returns zero if similarity is less than matching threshold, i.e. two face feature templates do not match (see ParameterMatchingThreshold and SetParameter method), and is greater than or equal to matching threshold otherwise.
It is recommended to use Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher instead of using Neurotec.Biometrics.NLMatcher.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLMatcher.Verify(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Method to verify to given templates.
member.param: Byte array with first face feature template(Neurotec.Biometrics.NLRecord). This template must be uncompressed.
Byte array with second face feature template(Neurotec.Biometrics.NLRecord). This template must be compressed.
member.remarks:
Method returns zero if similarity is less than matching threshold, i.e. two face feature templates do not match (see ParameterMatchingThreshold and SetParameter method), and is greater than or equal to matching threshold otherwise.
It is recommended to use NMatcher instead of using NLMatcher.

members.member: Enumerates biometric status values. These values are returned by NBiometricDevice.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.None
member.paraattr: Indicates that device is performing a concrete operation and can not return status value. E.g., fingerprint is swiped on a fingerprint scanner (operation is not finished yet and NBiometricDevice can not return any other value than None).

members.member: Indicates succeeded operation.
Indicates canceled operation.
Indicates that operation timed-out.
Indicates that biometric device should be cleaned.
Indicates that object(s) was not removed after\ NBiometricDevice finished operation.
Indicates that object is missing.
Indicates that object(s) was not found.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.TooFewObjects
member.paraattr: Indicates that too few objects was provided for device to succeed its operation. E.g., not enough fingerprints were scanned.

members.member: Indicates that too many objects were provided for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates sequence of bad object(s).
Indicates that spoof object was detected.
Indicates bad object.
Indicates that fingerprint was placed too soft on a device.
Indicates that fingerprint was placed too hard on a device.
Indicates bad fingerprint position.
Indicated that object was too north from device.
Indicated that object was too east from device.
Indicated that object was too south from device.
Indicated that object was too west from device.
Indicated that object was too close to device.
Indicated that object was too far from device.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.BadSpeed
member.paraattr: Indicates too slow/fast moving object during operation. E.g., fingerprint was swiped too slow (too fast) when fingerprint scanning operation was performed on a scanner.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.TooSlow
member.paraattr: Indicates that object was moving too slow. E.g., fingerprint was swiped through scanner too slow.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.TooFast
member.paraattr: Indicates that object was moving too fast. E.g., fingerprint was swiped through scanner too fast.

members.member: Indicates object's bad size.
Indicates that object is too short for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates that object is too long for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates that object is too narrow for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates that object is too wide for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates that object is too skewed.
Indicates that object was moving to wrong direction.

member.summary: Gets or sets quality of the minutia.
member.remarks: The quality of the minutia must be in the range [0, 100].The higher it is, the better the quality of the minutia is. If quality of the minutia is unknown it must be set to zero.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.Curvature
member.summary: Gets or sets the ridge curvature near minutia.
member.remarks: If curvature of the minutia is unknown it must be set to 255.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.G
member.summary: Gets or sets the G (ridge density) near minutia.
member.remarks: If G of the minutia is unknown it must be set to 255.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType
member.summary: Specifies type of ridge counts contained in NFRecord.
member.remarks: Extracted template with EightNeighborsWithIndexes parameter is bigger than the template extracted with EightNeighbors parameter. Templates extracted with EightNeighborsWithIndexes parameter is faster than the templates extracted with EightNeighbors parameter. Extracted template with FourNeighborsWithIndexes parameter is bigger than the template extracted with FourNeighbors parameter. Templates extracted with FourNeighborsWithIndexes parameter is faster than the templates extracted with FourNeighbors parameter.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.None
member.summary: The NFRecord does not contain ridge counts.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.FourNeighbors
member.summary: The NFRecord contains ridge counts to closest minutia in each of the four sectors of each minutia. First sector starts at minutia angle.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.EightNeighbors
member.summary: The NFRecord contains ridge counts to closest minutia in each of the eight sectors of each minutia. First sector starts at minutia angle.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.FourNeighborsWithIndexes
member.summary: The NFRecord contains ridge counts to four neighbors of each minutia.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.EightNeighborsWithIndexes
member.summary: The NFRecord contains ridge counts to eight neighbors of each minutia.

member.remarks:
\1. This function supports both NFRecord version 1.0 and 2.0 formats. Always returns NFPatternClass.Unknown for version 1.0 format.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor
member.summary: Provides functionality for extracting Neurotechnology Face Records (NLRecord) from face images.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterMinIod
member.summary: Identifier specifying minimum distance between eyes in face. Faces which have smaller distance between eyes than this parameter, won't be returned by the face detection methods.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterMaxIod
member.summary: Identifier specifying maximum distance between eyes in face. Faces which have greater distance between eyes than this parameter, won't be returned by the face detection methods.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterFaceConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Specifies the threshold which is considered when looking for faces in an image. For each face candidate confidence parameter is calculated. With higher threshold value faces are selected more strictly by the face detection method.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterFavorLargestFace
member.summary: If set to true the largest face found in an image will be used for facial feature extraction instead of the one with the highest face confidence score. The default value is true.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterMaxRollAngleDeviation
member.summary: Identifier specifying the maximum roll angle deviation from frontal face in degrees. The value of this parameter can be in range [0..180]. The default value is 15.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterMaxYawAngleDeviation
member.summary: Identifier specifying the maximum yaw angle deviation from frontal face in degrees. The value of this parameter can be in range [0..180]. The default value is 15.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDetectMoreFaces
member.summary: Identifier specifying whether to use different face detection procedure, which has a higher recall rate.

summary.paraattr: Identifier specifying number of scales in one octave when constructing scale space for face detection. Higher values mean slower face detection but higher recall rate. Values are in range [1..16].

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterFaceRollAngleBase
member.summary: Parameter specifying a base angle for faces roll angle in the image to search. Available values are these: -180; -90; 0; 90; 180. The default value is 0. Parameter is used to set extractor base angle to support mobile devices with orientation sensor.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDetectAllFeaturePoints
member.summary: Identifier specifying whether all facial feature points should be detected during facial feature detection. The default value is false.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDetectBaseFeaturePoints
member.summary: Identifier specifying whether base facial feature points should be detected during facial feature detection. Currently, base facial feature points are: center of right eye, center of left eye, nose tip and center of mouth. The default value is false.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterFaceQualityThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying the threshold which is considered when extracting facial features from the image. With higher threshold better quality of face image is required to successfully extract facial features. The value of this parameter can be in range [0..255]. The default value is 128.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterTemplateSize
member.summary: Identifier specifying template size parameter. Parameter value can be one of the TemplateSize enumeration members.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterUseLivenessCheck
member.summary: If set to true liveness check is performed while doing facial feature extraction from an image stream.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterLivenessThreshold
member.summary: This threshold checks if faces are extracted from a live image stream. The higher the value of this parameter, the more strictly the stream is checked if the face in it is real (for example if it's not forged by showing a photo of a person in front a camera). The value of this parameter can be in range [0..100]. The default value is 50.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterMaxRecordsPerTemplate
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of records an extraction method can return in one NLTemplate. The value of this parameter can be in range [1..16]. The default value is 4.

summary.paraattr: Identifier specifying maximum number of frames to use for extraction from stream.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDetectGender
member.summary: Identifier specifying whether gender should be estimated.

remarks.paraattr: By enabling this parameter (setting to true) you can ask to estimate person's gender from the face during facial features template extraction. Gender estimator works more accurate on near-frontal face images.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterGenderConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying the gender detection confidence threshold. If the confidence does not pass this threshold it will we reset to value 255 indicating that decision taking failed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDetectGlasses
member.summary: Identifier specifying whether glasses should be detected.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterGlassesConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying the glasses detection confidence threshold. If the confidence does not pass this threshold it will we reset to value 255 indicating that decision taking failed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDetectDarkGlasses
member.summary: Identifier specifying whether dark glasses should be detected.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDarkGlassesConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying the dark glasses detection confidence threshold. If the confidence does not pass this threshold it will we reset to value 255 indicating that decision taking failed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDetectExpression
member.summary: Identifier specifying whether expression should be estimated.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterExpressionConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying the expression detection confidence threshold. If the confidence does not pass this threshold it will we reset to value 255 indicating that decision taking failed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDetectBlink
member.summary: Identifier specifying whether closed eyes should be detected.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterBlinkConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying the blink detection confidence threshold. If the confidence does not pass this threshold it will we reset to value 255 indicating that decision taking failed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterDetectMouthOpen
member.summary: Identifier specifying whether open mouth should be detected.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.ParameterMouthOpenConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying the open mouth detection confidence threshold. If the confidence does not pass this threshold it will we reset to value 255 indicating that decision taking failed.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.NativeType
member.summary: Defines the native type of the object.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.NleTemplateSizeNativeType
member.summary: Defines the native type of the face extractor template size.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.NleExtractionStatusNativeType
member.summary: Defines the native type of the face extractor extraction status.

members.member:
Sets or gets minimum distance between eyes in face. Faces which have smaller distance between eyes than this parameter, won't be returned by the face detection methods. Must be in range [10..16384].
Note
If MinIod and/or MaxIod will be set very similar to the real distance between the eyes, it could cause to not so accurate results (of face detection).
When the face is set MinIod and MaxIod the face could be found up to ~1.5 times bigger/smaller value it is set.

Gets or sets maximum distance between eyes in face. Faces which have greater distance between eyes than this parameter, won't be returned by the face detection routines. Must be in range [10..16384].
Integer value which represents maximum Iod.
Note
If MinIod and/or MaxIod will be set very similar to the real distance between the eyes, it could cause to not so accurate results (of face detection).
When the face is set MinIod and MaxIod the face could be found up to ~1.5 times bigger/smaller value it is set.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.FaceConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold which is considered when looking for faces in an image. For each face candidate confidence parameter is calculated. With higher threshold value faces are selected more strictly by the face detection method. Must be in range [0..100].
member.value: Double value which represents face confidence threshold value.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.FavorLargestFace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the largest face will be used for facial features extraction.
member.value: Boolean value indicating if the largest face should be used for facial features extraction. If set to true the largest face found in an image will be used for facial feature extraction instead of the one with the highest ParameterFaceConfidenceThreshold score.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.MaxRollAngleDeviation
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum roll angle deviation from frontal face in degrees which is considered when looking for faces in an image. Must be in range [0..180].
member.value: Short value which represents maximum face roll angle deviation value.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.MaxYawAngleDeviation
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum yaw angle deviation from frontal face in degrees which is considered when looking for faces in an image. Must be in range [0..180].
member.value: Short value which represents maximum face yaw angle deviation value.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.DetectMoreFaces
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether face detection with higher recall should be used.
member.value: Boolean value indicating whether to use face detection procedure, which has a higher recall rate (but also a lower precision rate - more false detections).

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.FaceDetectionScaleCount
member.summary: Gets or sets face detection scale count (identifier specifying number of scales in one octave when constructing scale space for face detection. Higher values mean slower face detection but higher recall rate).
member.value: Int value which represents face detection scale count (values are in range [1..16].

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.FaceRollAngleBase
member.summary: Gets or sets faces base roll angle in the image to search. That's a base angle which together with MaxRollAngleDeviation defines the interval of angles considered when looking for faces in an image. Must be in range [-180..180].
member.value: Short value which represents face roll angle base.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.DetectAllFeaturePoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether all facial feature points should be detected.
member.value: Boolean value indicating whether all facial feature points should be detected. If the value is false, only centers of eyes or base facial features are detected, otherwise all supported facial feature points are detected.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.DetectBaseFeaturePoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether base facial feature points should be detected.
member.value: Boolean value indicating whether all facial feature points should be detected. If the value is true, center of right eye, center of left eye, nose tip and center of mouth are detected.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.FaceQualityThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold which is considered when extracting facial features from the image. With higher threshold better quality of face image is required to successfully extract facial features.
member.value: Byte value which represents face quality threshold.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.TemplateSize
member.summary: Gets or sets template size.

members.member:
Gets or sets liveness threshold which checks if faces are extracted from a live image stream. The higher the value of this parameter, the more strictly the stream is checked if the face in it is real (for example if it's not forged by showing a photo of a person in front a camera).
Note The value can be in range [0..100]. The default value is 50.
Liveness threshold value.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.UseLivenessCheck
member.summary: Sets or gets a boolean value indicating whether to use liveness check.
member.value: Boolean value indicating whether to use liveness check. The \property value is true if liveness check is performed while doing facial feature extraction from an image stream. Otherwise, the property value is false.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.MaxRecordsPerTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of records an extraction method can return in one NLTemlate.
member.value: Integer value which represents maximum number of record per template. The value can be in range [2..16]. The default value is 5.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.MaxStreamDurationInFrames
member.summary: Gets or sets identifier specifying maximum number of frames to use for extraction from stream.
member.value: Int value representing maximum stream duration in frames.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use gender detection procedure.
member.value: Bool value indicating whether to use gender detection procedure.

member.summary: Gets or sets a threshold for gender detection confidence.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLExtractor.GlassesConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets a threshold for glasses detection confidence.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatchingSpeed
member.summary: Specifies biometric templates matching speed.

remarks.paraattr: Slow matcher has low speed and medium speed matching options. Fast matcher has low, medium and high speed options.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatchingSpeed.Low
member.summary: Low matching speed (slower but more accurate).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatchingSpeed.Medium
member.summary: Medium matching speed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatchingSpeed.High
member.summary: High matching speed (faster but less accurate).

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMFusionType
member.summary: Specifies the fingerprints, palmprints, faces and irises matching fusion.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMFusionType.FuseAlways
member.summary: Always matches fingerprints, palmprints, faces and irises. The results of are fused.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMFusionType.SelectByFaceThenFuse
member.summary: Matches faces. If the result is greater than ParameterFacesMatchingThresholdNew, then matches fingerprints, palms and irises also and fuses results; otherwise, score is zero.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMFusionType.SelectByIrisThenFuse
member.summary: Matches irises. If the result is greater than ParameterIrisesMatchingThreshold, then matches fingerprints, palms and faces also and fuses results; otherwise, score is zero.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterMatchingThreshold
member.summary: Identifier specifying matching threshold (biggest allowed FAR) parameter of type int. Parameter value is equal to - 12 \* log10(FAR) and must be not less than zero (for example, 48 for FAR = 0.01%).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterFusionType
member.summary: Identifier specifying fingerprints and faces fusion of type int. Parameter value can be one of the NMFusionType enumeration members.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterFacesMatchingThreshold
member.summary: Matters only if ParameterFusionType is SelectByFaceThenFuse(NMFusionType) set.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterFacesMatchingThresholdNew
member.summary: Matters only if ParameterFusionType is SelectByFaceThenFuse(NMFusionType) set.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterIrisesMatchingThreshold
member.summary: Matters only if ParameterFusionType is SelectByIrisThenFuse(NMFusionType) set.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterFingersMaximalRotation
member.summary: Identifier specifying modulus of maximal rotation allowed between two matched NFRecords parameter of type N_TYPE_BYTE. Parameter value is specified in 180/128 degrees units and cannot be greater than 128 (180 degrees).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterFingersMatchingSpeed
member.summary: Specifies finger templates matching speed. Can be Low, Medium or High matching speed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterFingersFillFullMatchingDetails
member.summary: Specifies whether full matching details are filled during the fingers matching.

members.member: Parameter specifying fingers mode (parameter value set). Parameter value can be one of the FingersModeXXX.

summary.paraattr: Identifier specifying minimal number of fingerprints from probe template to match parameter of type int. Parameter value is from zero to NFTemplate.MaxRecordCount.

Identifier specifying matching threshold (biggest allowed FAR) when matching is stopped (with respect to Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterFingersMinMatchedCount parameter value) parameter of type N_TYPE_INT. Parameter value is equal to -12 * log10(FAR) and must be not less than zero (for example, 48 for FAR = 0.01%).

members.member:
Specifies face templates matching speed. Can be Low or High matching speed.
Note High matching speed is equal to Medium.

Specifies iris templates matching speed. Can be Low, Medium or High matching speed.
Note High speed is equal to Medium.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterIrisesMaximalRotation
member.summary: Defines the maximal rotation allowed between two matched irises. It is specified in 180/128 degrees units and cannot be greater than 128 (180 degrees).

summary.paraattr: Identifier specifying minimal number of irises from probe template to match parameter of type N_TYPE_INT. Parameter value is from zero to NET_MAX_RECORD_COUNT.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterIrisesMinMatchedCountThreshold
member.paraattr: Parameter specifying matching threshold (biggest allowed FAR) when matching is stopped (with respect to Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterIrisesMinMatchedCount parameter value). Parameter value is equal to -12 * log10(FAR) and must be not less than zero (for example, 48 for FAR = 0.01%).

summary.paraattr: Identifier specifying modulus of maximal rotation allowed between two matched NFRecords parameter of type N_TYPE_BYTE. Parameter value is specified in 180/128 degrees units and cannot be greater than 128 (180 degrees).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterPalmsMatchingSpeed
member.summary: Specifies palm templates matching speed. Can be Low, Medium or High matching speed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterPalmsFillFullMatchingDetails
member.summary: Specifies whether full matching details are filled during the palms matching.

summary.paraattr: Identifier specifying minimal number of palmprints from probe template to match parameter of type N_TYPE_INT. Parameter value is from zero to NFT_MAX_RECORD_COUNT.

Identifier specifying matching threshold (biggest allowed FAR) when matching is stopped (with respect to Neurotec.Biometrics.NMatcher.ParameterPalmsMinMatchedCount parameter value) parameter of type N_TYPE_INT. Parameter value is equal to -12 * log10(FAR) and must be not less than zero (for example, 48 for FAR = 0.01%).

member.summary: Provides properties for retrieving Ntfi attributes.

member.summary: Defines the native type of the object.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Tools.NtfiAttributes.Sharpness
member.summary: Gets sharpness score (a double value from range [0, 1]) of the tested token image.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Tools.NtfiAttributes.BackgroundUniformity
member.summary: Gets background uniformity score (a double value from range [0, 1]) of the tested token image.
member.value: A double value (in a range [0, 1]) of a background uniformity score of a token image.
member.remarks:
Background uniformity defines uniformity of a background. Agreeably to ISO/IEC 19794-5 standard the background of a picture should be monochromatic (unicolor) and uniform. Background uniformity score depends on these \parameters.
You should note that background is important for computer based face recognition because the first step in the computer face recognition process is the segmentation of the face from background. The best practise for background and common problems that should be avoided is defined as the following:
* Background segmentation. The boundary between the head and the background should be clearly identifiable about the entire subject. * Background shadows. There should be no shadows visible on the background behind the face image. * Background uniformity. The background should be plain, and shall contain no texture containing lines or curves. Therefore the background should be a uniform colour or a single colour pattern with gradual changes from light to dark luminosity in a single direction. The better background parameters are the better background uniformity score is.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Tools.NtfiAttributes.GrayscaleDensity
member.remarks: Grayscale density value is used for checking brightness in the facial region of an image.
member.summary: Gets grayscale density value.

members.member:
Neurotechnology token face images library. Provides functionality to create token face images (images that store extracted face information from any other image source) described in ISO/IEC 19794-5 and to test the attributes of previously created token face images.
NTFI library is intended to provide token face images compatible with the Face Image Format as in ISO/IEC 19794 standard. This face image format enables range of applications on variety of devices, including devices that have limited resources required for data storage, and improves recognition accuracy by specifying data format, scene constraints (lighting, pose), photographic properties (positioning, camera focus) and digital image attributes (image resolution, image size).
The NTFI library has the following features: * Token face image creation from an image containing human face using eye coordinates which may be either hand marked or detected automatically using Neurotechnology VeriLook face detection algorithm. * Face is detected and eye coordinates are acquired using state-of-the-art Neurotechnology VeriLook face detection and recognition algorithm. * Geometrical normalization of face image according to proportions and photographic properties in ISO/IEC 19794 standard. * Intelligent image padding algorithm for cut of parts of token face image as in ISO/IEC 19794 standard. * Test the created token face image for following quality criteria suggested in ISO/IEC 19794 standard: * Background uniformity (The background in the token face image should be uniform, not cluttered). * Sharpness (the token face image should not be blurred). * Too light or too dark images (the token face image should not be too dark or too light). * Exposure range of an image (the token face image should have a reasonable exposure range to represent as much details of the subject in the image as possible). * Evaluate token face image quality based on suggestions of ISO/IEC 19794 standard (Using the quality criteria above).
Note Functionality of the token face image library can be accessed from the Neurotec.Biometrics.Ntfi.dll which is a wrapper of Ntfi.dll.
